Question: What is Minds?
Answer: Minds is the world's leading free and open source social network where you are rewarded for your contributions to the network with crypto tokens.

Question: What is the goal of Minds?
Answer: The goal of Minds is to create a free and open Internet and ensure that people are fairly compensated for their efforts online with viral reach and revenue opportunity.

Question: Who founded Minds?
Answer: Bill Ottman founded Minds in 2011, and he is the current CEO.

Question: How do I contact Minds?
Answer: You can contact Minds by emailing info@minds.com.

Question: Can I invest in Minds?
Answer: Minds is currently a privately held company, though it took a major step in becoming community owned when it raised over $1 million from over 1,500 investors worldwide in a SEC Regulation CF equity-crowdfunding campaign. Minds will make all users aware of future investment opportunities when they are available.

Question: Can I use Minds official logo?
Answer: Yes, as long as it is not in an attempt to impersonate or suggest any direct affiliation to Minds.

Question: What is the Minds privacy policy?
Answer: You can read the full Minds privacy policy here - https://www.minds.com/p/privacy

Question: Where can I download the mobile app?
Answer: You can download the app from the Google Play store or the iOS App Store.

Question: How is my content licensed on Minds?
Answer: There are multiple content licenses to choose from, including GPL, Creative Commons, Public Domain, and All Rights Reserved. While uploading content through Minds.com, you will be prompted to choose a license; make sure to select the appropriate one! All license edits must be made from the Minds web app.

Question: What are the Minds Terms of Service?
Answer: All content legal under US law is permitted on the site. Certain malicious behavior on the site may result in a channel ban such as harassment, bullying, spam, threatening violence, and copyright infringement. Minds full Terms of Service can be found here - https://www.minds.com/p/terms

Question: Is there a way to filter the content I see?
Answer: You will see 100% of the content that you subscribe to. For any unsubscribed content (Boost or Discovery feeds), you can choose to use either our default feed, Open Feed or explicit feed. Our default feed only contains content that is acceptable under the Apple and Google developer terms of service. This is essential to ensure that our platform remains available on mobile devices. If you wish to view content that is more controversial, you can turn on "Open" by clicking on the gear icon in the top right of you feeds. To view explicit content, you can opt-in to explicit mode in your settings.

Question: How do I block a user?
Answer: You may block a user by going to their channel settings and selecting ‘Block’. You may also block a user by clicking the settings on their post (small down carrot icon), and selecting ‘Block User’.

Question: What does blocking a user do?
Answer: Blocking a user makes it so that user is no longer able to engage with your channel or any of the content or groups you own. You also will no longer see this user’s posts or Boosts, unless you specifically go to their channel.

Question: How do I report content?
Answer: If you come across content that you believe violates the Minds Terms of Service, you can click on the post options (small down carrot icon) and select ‘Report’. You then will be able to choose the reason for reporting the content. The content is then sent to the Minds admins for review.

Question: How do I submit an appeal?
Answer: If you wish to appeal a decision by the Minds admins regarding your content, you can do so in the 'Reported Content' section in your settings.

Question: How do I enable two factor authentication?
Answer: Click on your account settings. From here, select “Two factor authentication” and enter the phone number you want the security text delivered to. You will receive a code by text every time someone logs into your account.

Question: Am I required to give any personal information?
Answer: Minds users have the ability to remain anonymous, as you are not required to provide any personal information on signup. You are only required to provide personal information if you wish to participate in our rewards program. To participate in our rewards program, all you need to provide is your mobile device number. This number will be converted into a SHA256 unique hash ID that we will tie to your account to prove uniqueness. We will not store your number on our servers.

Question: How do I create an channel?
Answer: To create a new channel, enter your desired username along with your email address and password at https://minds.com

Question: How do I login?
Answer: Enter your username and password. Please note that your username is your @ handle on Minds, not your email address.

Question: Can I change my username?
Answer: You may not change your username after you create it. However, you can change your display name in your settings.

Question: How do I request a new password?
Answer: Select the "Forgot Password?" link from the login page. At this point, we will send you an email with a link to verify it is you and reset your password.

Question: Can I use two factor authentication?
Answer: Yes, you can enable two factor authentication in your settings.

Question: Can I deactivate my account?
Answer: In your account settings, choose “Deactivate channel” on the left-hand side of the screen. Your channel will be removed from Minds, but your content will remain. If you wish to delete your content, please do so before deactivating your account.

Question: Can I reactivate my account?
Answer: Yes, all you need to do is login again to reactivate your account.

Question: What is a channel?
Answer: A Minds channel is your profile and your home page on the site. Be anonymous if you want as Minds does not require any personally identifiable information to join. You will be asked for a valid email, but this too is optional. Beware, however, that if you do not enter a valid email your channel is not recoverable if you forget your password. From your Minds channel page, you can edit your avatar and banner, write a short bio, view your subscriptions and subscribers, enter status posts, and upload and manage your content. This is the page that other people will see when they visit you on Minds.

Question: How do I edit my channel?
Answer: To edit the information and images on your channel, you must first select the ‘edit’ button (notated with a pencil icon). Clicking this button enables you to change your avatar, banner photo, personal bio, social link, and membership rewards.

Question: How do I pin a post to my channel?
Answer: You may pin a maximum of three posts to the top of your channel feed. To do so, click on the bookmark icon located on the top of all of your posts. It will be filled in with gray when the post is pinned. Be sure to refresh your page once you have pinned a post to ensure it stays pinned.

Question: How do I view my images?
Answer: To view your images, go to the image gallery on your channel page and click "view all". You may also click on "Images" in the main navigation and then select "My Images".

Question: How do I view my videos?
Answer: To view your videos, go to the video gallery on your channel and click "view all". You can also click on "Videos" in the main navigation and then select "My Videos".

Question: How do I view my posts?
Answer: To view all of your posts, use the main feed on your channel.

Question: How do I view my blogs?
Answer: To view your blogs, go to the blog gallery on your channel and click "view all". You can also click on "Blogs" in the main navigation and then select "My Blogs".

Question: How do I view my subscribers and subscriptions?
Answer: To view your subscribers and subscriptions, click on the word "Subscribers" under your channel photo. From here, you can view both your subscribers and subscriptions. You can also find these lists by clicking on the "Channels" icon on the top-bar navigation, and then toggling to the "Subscribers" or "Subscriptions" lists.

Question: How do I update my avatar and banner photo?
Answer: To update your avatar and banner photo, click the pencil icon to edit your channel and then you can click on the avatar/banner areas to upload a new photo. Be sure to save your changes and refresh your browser after saving. Please note that it may take some time for your new avatar / banner to update throughout the entire site. If your avatar does not save properly, consider logging out of all devices and then log back in to synch on the last saved avatar.

Question: What can I upload or post to Minds?
Answer: You can post video files, image files, status posts, hyperlinks, and blogs on Minds.

Question: How can I post a thumbnail image with a link?
Answer: Add a space after the URL and a image thumbnail will appear. You may then delete the URL and the thumbnail will persist.

Question: How do I upload or post to Minds?
Answer: To post, simply type text or hyperlinks into the post entry field and click ‘Post’. To upload media, click on the paperclip icon in your status field. From here, you’ll be prompted to select the media file that you wish to upload. You will need to wait for the upload bar to complete before the ‘Post’ button will be highlighted and able to be clicked.

Question: What are the icons on a post for?
Answer: Each post has icons along the bottom of the post for other users to upvote, downvote, Wire, comment, or Remind. You will also see an option to ‘Boost’ on your own post. On the top of your post, you will see icons for post settings, translations (globe), or pinned posts.

Question: What is a pinned post?
Answer: You can pin up to 3 posts on your channel so they stay at the very top of your feed. These posts will remain at the top of your channel feed. To pin a post, click on the bookmark icon in the top right of your post.

Question: What is a Remind?
Answer: A ‘Remind’ is a way for users to share other people’s content on their own channel. This is a similar feature to a ‘share’ or ‘retweet’. To Remind a post, click on the share icon on the post and submit.

Question: How do I delete a post?
Answer: To delete a post, you can click on the post settings and then select "Delete".

Question: How do I share a post?
Answer: To share a post outside of Minds, you can click on the post settings and then select "Share". From here, you can choose to share the post to another social network or simply copy the link to your clipboard.

Question: How do I vote on something?
Answer: To upvote a post or comment, click on the thumbs up icon. To downvote a post or comment, click on the thumbs down.

Question: What can I vote on?
Answer: You can vote on any content on the site, including blogs, videos, status posts, and images. You can also vote on comments.

Question: Who does a vote do?
Answer: Voting determines which content is deemed the best (or worst) by the community. This enables the system to make this content more discoverable and reward the users for posting it.

Question: Is there a limit on how many times I can vote?
Answer: No, there is no limit on how many times you can vote, but using any type of bot or software to manipulate the voting tools is a bannable offense.

Question: How do I comment on something?
Answer: To comment on a post, click on the speech bubble icon on the bottom of every post. From here, you can enter your comment.

Question: What can I comment on?
Answer: You can comment on any post, image, video or blog on Minds. You can also reply to other user's comments.

Question: Is there a limit on how many times I can comment?
Answer: No, there is no limit on how many times you can comment on something.

Question: Can I upload media into my comments?
Answer: You can currently upload an image file to a comment, or a thumbnail preview for a hyperlink.

Question: How do I upload an image?
Answer: To upload an image, click on the paperclip icon in the post entry field and select the image file you wish to upload. When the loading bar has completed, the ‘post’ button will illuminate and you can click it to submit.Make sure to wait for teh Post button to FULLY illuminate as athere can be a delay and clicking prematurely will cause the upload to fail.

Question: What image file types are supported?
Answer: All major image file types are supported.

Question: Where can I see all of my images?
Answer: To view your images, go to the image gallery on your channel and click "view all". You can also click on "Images" in the main navigation and then select "My Images".

Question: Are there any limitations to what I can upload?
Answer: You may upload any image that adheres to our Terms of Service.

Question: How do I upload a video?
Answer: To upload a video, click on the paperclip icon in the post entry field and select the video file you wish to upload. When the loading bar has completed, the ‘post’ button will illuminate and you can click it to submit.

Question: What video file types are supported?
Answer: All major video file types are supported.

Question: Where can I see all of my videos?
Answer: To view your videos, go to the video gallery on your channel and click "view all". You can also click on "Videos" in the main navigation and then select "My Videos".

Question: Are there any limitations to what I can upload?
Answer: Currently, Minds only accepts videos under 30 minutes in length.

Question: How do I write a blog?
Answer: Click blogs from the navigation bar in the top center of the screen and select “WRITE A NEW BLOG.” A blog will open, and then just start writing.

Question: Where can I view all of my blogs?
Answer: To view your blogs, go to the blog gallery on your channel and click "view all". You can also click on "Blogs" in the main navigation and then select "My Blogs".

Question: How do I save a draft?
Answer: Click "Save Draft" at the bottom of the page and your blog will be saved without being published to your channel.

Question: How do I publish a blog?
Answer: To publish a blog, click on "Publish" when you are finished writing. This will post the blog to your channel feed and to all of your subscribers. If you need to make an edit after you publish your blog, then make the edit and Remind the blog from your gallery to republish the blog.

Question: How do I set a banner photo for my blog?
Answer: To set a banner photo for your blog, simply click on the large gray area above the blog and select the photo you wish to set as the banner.

Question: How do I upload media into my blog?
Answer: To upload media into your blog, click on the + icon next to the text cursor. From there, you can choose to upload either an image or video. For images, you can copy an image address, or upload directly from your computer. For videos, you will need to use a link.

Question: How do I format my blog?
Answer: To access the formatting options, you must first highlight the text you wish to format. At this point, all formatting options will appear in the black bar.

Question: How do I monetize a blog?
Answer: There are two ways to monetize your blog. First, you can lock your blog behind a paywall and charge other people on Minds a specified amount to view it. To do this, click on the lightning bolt 'Wire' icon and select the amount you wish to charge. More information on Wire may be found at https://minds.com/wire

Question: How do I create a group?
Answer: Click the navigation bar in the top-center of the screen and select “Groups.” From there, you will be prompted to “Start a new group."

Question: How do I edit the group settings?
Answer: To edit a group, click on the pencil icon which will open all fields for edit. From here, you can edit the group name, description, banner image, avatar image, associated tags, privacy options, permission options, and default feed.

Question: What is the group 'feed'?
Answer: The group feed is where you can see all posts from members of the group. This is the default group setting, but you can navigate to it by clicking on "feed" under the avatar.

Question: What is the group 'conversation'?
Answer: The group conversation is where you can have a live conversation with all members of the group. You can navigate to this by clicking on "conversation" under the avatar.

Question: How do I invite people to the group?
Answer: To invite people to the group, click on "Members" and you will see the option to search for users who you want to invite. Then, simply enter the name to send them an invitation. You may only send invitations to join a group to your subscribers.

Question: How do I promote the group?
Answer: Under the group description, you will see the option to "Boost" your group. This will promote the group to the rest of the Minds network.

Question: How do I make someone an admin of the group?
Answer: To make someone a group admin, click on "Members" and find the user, then click on the gear icon on their channel card and select "Make Admin".

Question: How do I prevent spam in my group?
Answer: The best way to prevent spam in groups is to moderate the posts. This means that any post that someone submits will have to be approved or rejected by a group admin or owner. If you do not wish to moderate, you will need to manually remove any spam posts by selecting "Delete" on the post settings.

Question: How do I remove someone from my group?
Answer: To remove a group member, you must search for their username in the members section, click the gear icon on their channel card, and select "Remove from Group".

Question: What is Messenger?
Answer: Minds Messenger is a feature for users to directly communicate with one another in an encrypted chat.

Question: How do I set up Messenger?
Answer: Minds requires you to create a password for Messenger before using the feature. This is necessary for your chat to be encrypted. This password should be different than your login password to protect your chat in case your channel is compromised.

Question: Why do I need a password for Messenger?
Answer: Passwords are required to ensure the privacy of your chats in case your channel is compromised. This password is known only by you, and is the only way to unlock your Messenger private key which is used to decrypt your private messages. Not even Minds has access to the contents of your chat.

Question: What if I forget my password?
Answer: If you forget your password, you can reset it by clicking on the Messenger Settings cog and selecting ‘Re-Key’. However, please note that by resetting your password your chat history will be deleted for your privacy protection.

Question: My chat is unreadbale and displayed as bubbles
Answer: Your chat history has been destroyed because you have rekeyed your encryption key. Your chat partners, however, still have their chat history with you.

Question: How do I message someone?
Answer: To find a channel to message search for their username in the search box in the window. If you have not entered a messenger password, you will be promoted at this time.

Question: How can I tell if someone is online?
Answer: A blue dot will appear in your messenger to indicate a channel is online.

Question: How can I tell if I have a message?
Answer: If another user has messaged you, the Messenger window will flash yellow, and you will see a green dot next to the name of the user who messaged you. You will also receive a notification.

Question: Where can I find my notifications?
Answer: All of your notifications can be found by clicking on the bell icon in the top navigation. From here, you can see all activity related to your channel. You can also filter the notifications for specific activity, such as comments, tags, wires, subscribers, etc.

Question: What do the icons in my notifications mean?
Answer: Within your notifications window, you can hover over each icon to see what type of notification it resembles.

Question: How can I turn off notifications?
Answer: Notifications be tmayurned off or muted in three ways: 1) Mute a post in the post drop down menu 2) mute a group in the settings cog of the group 3) block a user.

Question: What is Plus?
Answer: Become a valued Minds supporter by signing up for Minds Plus. We rely on this income to keep our servers humming, and we really appreciate the support from Minds Plus users. Plus is a paid subscription that provides you with added benefits on Minds across all mobile and web channels. The benefits include: Opt-out of all ads and boosted content on the site; Access to exclusive Minds content; Add a Plus badge on your channel; and Request to become verified. Visit https://minds.com/plus for more information.

Question: What does opting out of Boosts mean?
Answer: A typical user will see Boosted, or promoted, content throughout their newsfeed and other areas of the site. Opting out of Boosts makes it so you do not see any Boosted content anywhere on the site.

Question: What is exclusive Minds content?
Answer: Periodically throughout the month, the Minds team will post exclusive content for all Plus users to provide a closer look at what is going on behind-the-scenes at our headquarters. Access to monthly hangouts with the Minds team will also be included to provide users with the opportunity to ask questions and discuss ideas. Exclusive Minds content will continue to evolve as the site continues to grow.

Question: What is a Plus badge?
Answer: By signing up, you will receive a Plus badge on your profile by default. This is intended to make your profile stand out and allow you to show that you are a supporter of Minds. You may also choose to remove this badge from your channel, if desired.

Question: What does it mean to become verified?
Answer: Plus provides you with the option to request a verified badge. Submit a request and post your Minds channel link on at least two other social sites so we know it is you. The Minds team will review the submission and verify that you actually are who you claim to be. This helps our community confirm that you are the real channel and not an imposter.

Question: What is the cancellation policy?
Answer: You may cancel your Plus subscription at any time by going to your settings and then clicking on billing. Refunds and credits will not be issued for partial billing periods.

Question: What are Minds tokens?
Answer: Minds tokens are the network's crypto-token. They are built using the ERC-20 utility standard and are issued on the Ethereum blockchain. You earn Minds tokens for your contributions to the network, and can exchange them for more views on your content with Boost or to support other creators with Wire.

Question: How do I earn Minds tokens?
Answer: You earn Minds tokens for your contributions to the network each day. Contributions include setting up your account, referring new users, posting high quality content, being active on the site, contributing code, finding bugs and more. For more information on how to earn, please visit https://minds.com/wallet/tokens/contributions.

Question: How do I buy Minds tokens?
Answer: More information on purchasing Minds Tokens will be released in the future. During the Testnet phase users will be provided with a token allocation based on on their previous points balance. Users will also be rewarded tokens based on their conributions, and additional boost views may be purchased seperately.

Question: How can I use my Minds tokens?
Answer: Minds tokens are accepted as payment for all services on the Minds network, including Boost, Wire, Plus and more. You may exchange your tokens for views on your content with Boost, or you may send them to other channels as a tip or for custom rewards with Wire.

Question: Can I exchange my Minds tokens?
Answer: The Minds token is a utility token meant for application on the Minds platform. There is the possibility that Minds tokens may be traded on third party exchanges, but we have not encouraged or facilitated this in any way. This information is solely to reduce the number of support inquiries regarding this topic.

Question: What is the total supply of Minds tokens?
Answer: Information regarding the supply will be released with the rest of the tokenomics in the future.

Question: What percentage of Minds tokens were sold in the token Distribution Event?
Answer: Information regarding the token allocation will be released with the rest of the tokenomics in the future.

Question: What percentage of Minds tokens are reserved for user rewards?
Answer: Information regarding the token allocation will be released with the rest of the tokenomics in the future.

Question: What will the remainder of Minds tokens be allocated towards?
Answer: Information regarding the token allocation will be released with the rest of the tokenomics in the future.

Question: Why do I need Ethereum to execute a transaction?
Answer: A small Ethereum "gas" fee is required in order to execute a transaction on the Ethereum blockchain. These fees are the incentive provided for Ethereum miners to fulfill the transaction. OffChain tokens will not require any gas fee. OnChain tokens will require a gas fee, but this fee is waved during the Testnet period.

Question: How do I get Ethereum?
Answer: More information regarding how to get real Ethereum for the main network will be provided in the future when we transition out of the TestNet phase.

Question: How do I earn rewards?
Answer: To earn rewards you must first provide your mobile number and verify your account. Once you have completed this step, you will begin earning rewards for your contributions to the network each day.

Question: Why do I need to provide my mobile number?
Answer: Your mobile number is required for us to create a unique hash ID for your account. This is essential for us to make sure that all engagement channel's receive is unique to prevent fraud and gaming of the system. All mobile numbers are converted to a unique SHA-256 hash, and your mobile number will never be stored on the Minds servers in raw format.

Question: What is my "Contribution Score"?
Answer: Each day, you will receive a Contribution Score based on the amount you contributed to the network. Contributions include posting high quality content, referring new users, gaining subscribers, and being active on the site. The algorithm used to measure contribution is can be found at https://minds.com/wallet/tokens/contributions.

Question: What is the "Daily Reward Pool"?
Answer: The Daily Reward Pool is the number of Minds tokens reserved for user rewards each day.

Question: How is my daily Minds token payout determined?
Answer: At the end of each day, your Contribution Percentage will be applied to the Daily Reward Pool to determine how many Minds tokens you earned. For example, if your Contribution Percentage is 1% and the Daily Reward Pool is 10,000 Minds tokens, then you would earn 100 Minds tokens (1% * 10,000) for your contributions to the network that day.

Question: How will I receive my daily rewards?
Answer: Daily rewards will be paid out in OffChain tokens. OffChain tokens represent a 1 to 1 reservation of an OnChain Minds token, and after you verify, you can withdraw them at anytime into your OnChain address.

Question: What is the limit required to withdraw Minds tokens?
Answer: There is not minumum or maximum limit required to withdraw OnChain Minds tokens, but there is a limit of one withdrawl per day, and an Ethereum transaction fee will apply.

Question: How do I withdraw Minds tokens?
Answer: To withdraw Minds tokens, go to your wallet and click on "Withdraw". From here, you can submit your request to withdraw your Minds tokens and have them deposited into your Ethereum wallet. You will need to pay a small ETH gas fee in order to execute the withdrawal.

Question: Where can i keep track of my earnings?
Answer: You may track all of your Minds token earnings in your wallet. https://minds.com/wallet/tokens/transactions

Question: What is my wallet?
Answer: This is your localized wallet to store your Minds tokens. It is located by the bank icon in the top right corner of your browser. You may easily integrate any existing Ethereum wallet with your Minds wallet to send and receive Minds tokens.

Question: Where can I find my wallet?
Answer: Your wallet is located in the top navigation and is symbolized by a bank icon.

Question: What is an OnChain address?
Answer: An OnChain address is an Ethereum address where you can store your Minds tokens. Transactions using your OnChain address will be published to the public Ethereum blockchain and require a small Ethereum 'Gas' fee. You can chooes to setup your own private key or use a client such as MetaMask.

Question: What is MetaMask?
Answer: MetaMask is a browser plug-in that bridges the distributed web of tomorrow to your browser today. It allows you to run Ethereum decentralized applications right in your browser without running a full Ethereum node. MetaMask provides a secure identity vault and a user interface to manage your identities and sign blockchain transactions on different sites. You can install the MetaMask browser plug-in on Chrome, Firefox, Opera, and the new Brave browser.

Question: Can I use an existing Ethereum address?
Answer: Yes, you can use your own existing Ethereum address for your OnChain address. To import an existing address, visit the "Addresses" menu item in your wallet and select to change your OnChain address. Then click 'Provide Address'.

Question: Can I create a new Ethereum address?
Answer: Yes, you can create a new Ethereum address for your OnChain address. By selecting this option, Minds will generate a public key for your OnChain address and allow you to download your Private Key. Please note that you are responsible for safely storing your Private Key. Minds does not store your Private Key and cannot help you recover your account should you lose this Private Key. We encourage paper backup for your key stored safely to prevent loss as this password may not be recovered.

Question: What is a Receiver address and how do I set it up?
Answer: Your Receiver address is the address you wish to use to receive payments from other channels on Minds, through Boost or Wire. We recommend using the same address for both your OnChain and Receiver addresses for the most seamless experience.

Question: What is an OffChain address?
Answer: An OffChain address is your local address where you can store your Minds tokens. Transactions using your OffChain address will not be published to the blockchain and will be referenced to a Minds database that is immutable at the application level. There are no fees associated with OffChain transactions, but there are daily spending limits. All daily contribution rewards will be deposited into your OffChain address.

Question: What is my total balance?
Answer: In your wallet, you will see a total balance of Minds tokens located under the Minds logo. This balance is the sum of both your OnChain and OffChain address balances.

Question: How do I withdraw tokens from my OffChain address?
Answer: OffChain tokens maintain a 1 to 1 reservation for OnChain tokens. You can withdraw tokens from your OffChain address into your OnChain address at any time. You will need to pay an Ethereum Gas fee in order to process the withdrawal transaction.

Question: What is an Ethereum Gas fee?
Answer: All transactions that are published onto the public Ethereum blockchain will require a transaction fee, otherwise known as a 'Gas' fee. This is a small amount of Ether that must be sent alongside your Minds token payment in order for the transaction to be processed.

Question: What is Boost?
Answer: Boost is the anti-surveillance ad network on Minds for you to gain views on your content from the network in exchange for Minds tokens or USD. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: How do I Boost?
Answer: You can Boost your post, media or channel by clicking the "Boost" button on the desired content, and completing the prompt to request a specific number of views, what category to target, and your payment method. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: What are the different types of Boost?
Answer: There are three different types of Boosts on Minds: Newsfeed, Sidebar and Channel, Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: What is a Newsfeed Boost?
Answer: A Newsfeed Boost delivers guaranteed views on your posts in exchange for USD or Minds tokens. We place Newsfeed Boosts in the rotating queue at the top of the newsfeed or every twelve posts in the newsfeed. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: What is a Sidebar Boost?
Answer: A Sidebar Boost delivers guaranteed views on your channel, video, image or blog in exchange for USD or Minds tokens. We place Sidebar Boosts on the sidebar of the newsfeed and other user's content. Sidebar views are not counted on the newsfeed view counter. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: What is a Channel Boost?
Answer: A Channel Boost is a peer-to-peer offer to pay another Minds channel in USD or Minds tokens in exchange for a guaranteed Remind (share). Channel Boost offers may be accepted or rejected. Use a Channel Boost to target specific communities with content. Build a great channel on Minds and earn revenue by accepting Channel Boost offers to Remind other users’ content to your audience. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: What is a Priority Boost?
Answer: A Priority Boost places your content at the very front of the line. This enables you to fulfill the number of views you request much more quickly and react to breaking or live events. Priority Boost rates are subject to surge pricing. The minimum price is twice regular Boost rates. Read more: https://minds.com/boost

Question: How do I pay for a Boost?
Answer: You can pay for a Boost with USD or Minds tokens. If you choose to use Minds tokens, you can pay using your OnChain or your OffChain address.

Question: What happens if I pay with my OnChain address?
Answer: If you choose to pay with your OnChain address, then your Boost transaction will be published to the public Ethereum blockchain. You will also need to pay a small Ethereum gas fee in order to process the transaction.

Question: What happens if I pay with my OffChain address?
Answer: If you choose to pay with your OffChain address, then your Boost transaction will not be published to the public blockchain and will instead be stored on the Minds database. This database is immutable (cannot be changed) at the application level. You will not be required to pay any fees using this address, but spending limits will apply.

Question: What counts as a view?
Answer: A view is defined by a post passing through the center of someone's screen.

Question: How do I track the status of my Boost?
Answer: You can keep track of your boosted content in your Boost Console located in the top-bar navigation. In this console, you can track the status of your newsfeed Boosts, sidebar Boosts, and any offers you have sent or received for Channel Boosts.

Question: How long does a Boost take to complete?
Answer: Boost completion time varies and is a function of our Boost backlog and site activity.

Question: What is the Boost content policy?
Answer: Minds Boost Policy can be found in the Boost Policy section of our Terms of Service. Read more: https://www.minds.com/p/terms

Question: What is Wire?
Answer: Wire is the peer-to-peer payment and crowdfunding system on Minds. Minds tokens are accepted through Wire. Read more: https://minds.com/wire

Question: Why would I Wire someone?
Answer: You can Wire another channel to support their content or to subscribe to their reward tiers.

Question: How do I make my Wire recurring?
Answer: To make your Wire recur on a monthly basis, check the box that says "repeat this transaction monthly" before submitting.

Question: How do I cancel a recurring Wire?
Answer: To cancel a recurring Wire subscription, go to the billing section of your settings and under the recurring payment section, click cancel.

Question: How can I keep track of my Wire history?
Answer: You can track all of your Wire transaction history in your Wallet.

Question: What is a reward tier?
Answer: Reward tiers are ways for content creators to build their own membership business on Minds. Creators can set different levels of reward tiers that provide different value for their supporters, similar to Patreon or other crowdfunding sites.

Question: How do I create a reward tier?
Answer: You can set all of your reward tiers directly on your channel or Wallet by editing the widget called “Rewards”. In this widget, you can set the payment required and description for each level of rewards. Users must then Wire you the amount specified in order to access the rewards associated with each subscription.

Question: How do I make content exclusive to my premium subscribers?
Answer: You have the option of making every post on Minds exclusive by clicking on the Wire icon on the post and specifying how much users must have Wired you in order to view the post. For example, you can set a post limited only to users who have Wired you 5 tokens that month. The post will appear locked to all users except those who meet the criteria.

Question: Is Minds fully open source?
Answer: Yes. Minds.com and the Minds mobile app are both licensed under a AGPLV3 license.

Question: Where can I find the project?
Answer: The code is entirely free and open source and can be found at https://minds.org or https://github.com/minds.

Question: Can I earn rewards for contributing?
Answer: Yes, developers who find bugs or contribute code or documentation may qualify for Minds token rewards. All developer contributions will first be reviewed by the Minds staff to determine if they qualify for a reward.

Question: How do I get test Ethereum for the TestNet?
Answer: We will automatically deposit test Ethereum tokens into your wallet when you configure your OnChain address. You can also claim more ETH from www.rinkeby.io.

Question: What can I do with a TestNet token?
Answer: Tokens held during the TestNet phase will have the same utility on Minds as a normal token. They are accepted for boost, Wire, Plus and more. You can exchange them for views on content with Boost, or you can send them to other channels as a tip or for custom rewards with Wire. These tokens are not transferable and are running on the Rinkeby Ethereum Test network. More information regarding the transition to the Main Ethereum network will be released in the future.

Question: What happened to my Points balance?
Answer: Your Points balance has been converted into OffChain tokens for the TestNet phase. OffChain tokens hold the same exact value as Points. You can use them to Boost your content for more views, or send to other channels you support with Wire. We have exchanged your Points for OffChain tokens at a rate of 1,000 Points per 1 token.

Question: Why can't I receive any more payments in USD?
Answer: With the addition of crypto, Minds has migrated away from the Stripe platform. This is an important step to become more independent and less reliant on proprietary third parties. Any user who was receiving a recurring monthly payment in USD through Stripe will continue to receive these payments. Any new payment will be in Minds tokens.

Question: How long will the TestNet go on for?
Answer: The TestNet will remain in production for all users until further notice. This is an important step because it allows us time to audit our smart contracts and code, improve the rewards scoring and distribution systems, and just as we have done during Minds beta, gain critical feedback from the community on areas where we may improve.

Question: When will the token ecomomics be released?
Answer: We do not have a date for this yet. We are using the TestNet phase to make necessary changes and gain more insight on our token economics.

Question: How many tokens are in the daily reward pool during the TestNet?
Answer: We will be testing out different reward distributions throughout the TestNet phase. For this reason, there is no set answer as the total amount of tokens in the token reward pool may vary each day.

Question: What happens to my existing subcription to Points or Minds Plus?
Answer: Anyone who had an existing recurring monthly subscription for either Points or a Minds Plus account will receive the same value as they were previously. The only difference will be that these users will receive OffChain tokens in place of the Points.

Question: What happens if I have been supporting another channel with a monthly recurring USD payment?
Answer: If you are using Wire to support another channel on a monthly basis with USD, your payments will continue as normal. If you wish to cancel this subscription, you can do so in the billing section of your settings.
